resources.string: Please post bug reports and feature requests at the github page.
Press the start button to start the automatic measurement. Then hold the microphone of your phone next to the line and slap the line with your finger. Wait until the measurement is finished.
measuring...\nThe measurement will stop automatically when the time of oscillation got recognized. If you get no result you can slap the line again.
The measured time of oscillation is
This App is still under early development. Do not trust the calculated values.

If you slap the Line an acoustic wave is propagating along the line and reflected multiple times. The propagation speed is dependent on the force of the line. Therefore it is possible to calculate the pretension of the line from the frequency of the sound with the following formula:
4*m*l^2 / t^2 \n\nm is the mass per unit length, l is the length of the line and t the time between the sounds. For more information on the parameters click on the name of the parameter
If you specify a specific Webbing the stretch and weight of the Line get filled automatically. If you can not find your Webbing, you can just enter those values manually.

For the pretension measurement the stretch is only used to calculate the decrease of the weight per meter of the webbing due to the stretch of the Line. This should only be relevant on Lines with a very high stretch. The stretch is assumed to be linear here.
The propagation speed of a wave on a tensioned Line is dependent on the weight per unit length of the Line. Therefore it is important put the right value here.
The Length of the line between the two line lockers.

The calculation of the static forces is based on the formula F = sqrt(sag^2 + length^2/4) * m*g / (2 * sag). m is the weight of the slackliner and g the gravity acceleration. If the stretch behavior of the line is known, it is also possible to calculate the pretension of the line from the force. For Rodeo lines the initial sag without a slackliner on the line gets calculated. You can change any parameter and get ask automatically which parameter you want to calculate. For further information on the parameters you can click on the parameter names.
If you select a webbing here the stretch gets filled automatically. If you do not find your webbing you can just type the stretch yourself

The stretch of the line is needed to calculate the pretension and for rodeo lines the initial sag without a slacker of the line. If you change the stretch manually it is assumed to be linear. If you select a Webbing a custom stretch curve is used if available.
The Length of the line in meters
The sag of the line if a slackliner is standing in the middle of the line
The weight of the slackliner who is standing on the line
The force that appears at the anchor point when a slackliner is standing in the middle of the line
The pretension of the line without a slackliner on the line

The initial sag of a rodeo line, if no slackliner is standing on the line. If the initial sag is greater than zero the pretension of the line has to be zero. For lines with a pretension greater than zero this parameter is always zero.

The maximum forces on the line and the slackliner during bouncing, jumping and leash falls get calculated. The actual calculation is more a simulation of the dynamic movement. For small time steps the position, force and acceleration of the slackliner get calculated. The maximum values, when the slackliners speed changes direction, get saved.
If you select a webbing here the stretch gets filled automatically. If you do not find your webbing you can just type the stretch yourself

To do dynamic calculations on a slackline the stretch behavior of the line has to be known. If you change the stretch manually it is assumed to be linear. If you select a Webbing a custom stretch curve is used if available.
The Length of the line in meters
The pretension of the line in kN

The initial sag of a rodeo line, if no slackliner is standing on the line. If the initial sag is greater than zero the pretension of the line has to be zero. For lines with a pretension greater than zero this parameter is always zero.
The weight of the slackliner standing on the line

Maximum height during a bounce or jump in relation to the static standing position of the slackliner. For leash falls this value should be the leash length plus the height of your harness (static leash assumed).
The maximum acceleration of the slackliner in relation to the gravity acceleration
The maximum Force that affects the Slackliner.
The maximum force that could be measured at the anchors of the slackline
The maximum sag of the line during bouncing or jumping
Can not calculate Forces. Please select a webbing with non zero stretch
